episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the art of making artificial sushi in Japan, the gruesome effects of the Mount Vesuvius eruption on human skulls, the invention and environmental impact of bendy straws, and the surprising effectiveness of bomb detectors fitted with fake dog noses.

facts.fact: It takes 10 years to learn how to make artificial sushi to make it well.
When Mount Vesuvius erupted, it created mini volcanoes in some people's heads.
The first bendy straws were used by people in hospital.
Bomb detectors in America work 16 times better when they are fitted with a fake dog nose on the end.
